Class GraphicsHelper

java.lang.Object
GraphicsHelper
public class GraphicsHelper extends Object
The main GraphicsHelper, a singleton class representing one drawable window. This class contains all the drawing methods for interacting with the DrawCanvas. By default, the window opened is 720x720.

Example: 

 // get the instance of this class, or create it if it doesn't exist
 GraphicsHelper gfx = GraphicsHelper.getInstance();
 // draw a circle on the center point with radius 100
 gfx.drawCircle(gfx.center(), 100, Color.BLUE);
 // refresh the canvas, redrawing all objects to be drawn
 gfx.refresh();
See Also:
  • DrawCanvas

  • Method Details

    • center

      public Vec2 center()
      Returns a Vec2, representing the center of the drawing area.
      Returns:
      an integer Vec2 containing the center's coordinates.

    • getInstance

      public static GraphicsHelper getInstance()
      Returns the current instance of this GraphicsHelper. As GraphicsHelper is a singleton, there is only one instance on each run. getInstance() should be called instead of any constructors to create a GraphicsHelper object.
      Returns:
      the current instance of GraphicsHelper.

    • setWindowSize

      public static void setWindowSize(int w, int h)
      Sets the window size of this GraphicsHelper.
      Parameters:
      w - width of the window
      h - height of the window

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the draw queue, removing all objects from the queue. This method does not refresh. See flush()

    • flush

      public void flush()
      Flushes the draw queue, removing all objects drawn on screen.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refreshes and re-draws all objects in the draw queue. In order to draw new objects, refresh() must be called after any drawing methods.

    • drawLine

      public void drawLine(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double thickness, Color c)
      Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) with a fixed thickness and color.
      Parameters:
      x1 - x1 in pixels
      y1 - y1 in pixels
      x2 - x2 in pixels
      y2 - y2 in pixels
      thickness - width of the line stroke in pixels.
      c - color of the line.

    • drawLine

      public void drawLine(Vec2 p1, Vec2 p2, double thickness, Color c)
      Draws a line from p1 to p2 with a fixed thickness and color.
      Parameters:
      p1 - p1, a Vec2 in pixels
      p2 - p2, a Vec2 in pixels
      thickness - width of the line stroke in pixels.
      c - color of the line.

    • drawCircle

      public void drawCircle(double x, double y, double r, Color c)
      Draws a circle with radius r at (x, y) with a fixed color.
      Parameters:
      x - x in pixels
      y - y in pixels
      r - r in pixels
      c - color of the point.

    • drawCircle

      public void drawCircle(Vec2 pt, double r, Color c)
      Draws a circle with radius r at pt with a fixed color.
      Parameters:
      pt - pt, a Vec2 in pixels
      r - r in pixels
      c - color of the point.

    • drawCircleOutline

      public void drawCircleOutline(double x, double y, double r, double thickness, Color c)
      Draws the outline of a circle with radius r at (x, y) with a fixed color and brush thickness.
      Parameters:
      x - x in pixels
      y - y in pixels
      r - r in pixels
      thickness - width of the outline stroke in pixels.
      c - color of the outline stroke.

    • drawCircleOutline

      public void drawCircleOutline(Vec2 center, double r, double thickness, Color c)
      Draws the outline of a circle with radius r at a center point with a fixed color and brush thickness.
      Parameters:
      center - center, a Vec2 in pixels
      r - r in pixels
      thickness - width of the outline stroke in pixels.
      c - color of the outline stroke.

    • printObjects

      public void printObjects()
      Prints the entire contents of the drawing queue.

    • delay

      public void delay(double s)
      Delays the main thread and display thread from doing anything for s seconds.
      Parameters:
      s - number of seconds to delay. Processed with millisecond precision.
